content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></math> be the function satisfying <math alttext="f of 0, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, the fraction with numerator the natural log of, open parenthesis, x plus 2, close parenthesis, and denominator x squared, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than, negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the length of the graph of <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> over the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.13: (BC ONLY) The Arc Length of a Smooth, Planar Curve and Distance Traveled

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
